title: Deaths in Yellowstone National Park
name: Deaths in Yellowstone National Park
description:
A Map by Urbanatlagent

A map of various deaths and accidents occurring in or near Yellowstone National Park.

properties.description: Posted by UrbanatlagentOn July 10, 1970 at the campground across from Devil\'s Slide, Stanley Dean Baker and Harry Allen Stroup murdered, dismembered and cannibalized James Michael Schlosser. This location is an aproximate guess.

Posted by UrbanatlagentSomewhere between Dot Island and Breeze Point, Park rangers found two lifejackets,a cooler, and a canoe paddle that had belonged to Steve Smith,21 and Kenneth Ables, 19 both of whom apparently drowned on their way to Peale Island on July 19/20 1967. Their bodies have never found.

Posted by UrbanatlagentOn a warm day in September 5, 1885, M.D Scott, a USGS worker set out to go to nearby Mary Bay in Yellowstone Lake in a sailboat with 3 other USGS workers. In this aproximate location Scott died upon being struck in the head by lightening while manning the oars near the boat\'s mast. The three other men survived.
Posted by Urbanatlagent

properties.name: Otter Creek
properties.description: Posted by Urbanatlagent  Wildlife photographer, William Tesinsky was killed by a sow grizzly, bear #59, in early October 1986, when he got too close to the bear in an attempt to get photos.

properties.name: Bacon Rind Creek
properties.description: Posted by UrbanatlagentAt the Civilian Conservation Corp camp at Bacon Rind Creek in July of 1933, an 18 year old worker, Abraham Yankovitch, was killed by a blow to the head he received from George Satriano, during a fight.

properties.name: Devils Slide
properties.description: Posted by Urbanatlagent, , MT

properties.name: Fountain Paint Pot, WY
properties.description: Posted by UrbanatlagentOn July 20, 1981 David Alllen Kirwan of California dove head first into the Celestine Pool located in the Fountain Paint Pot area, in an attempt to retrieve his dog Moosie, who had jumped into the pool after escaping from the car. Kirwan suffered from 3rd degree burns over 100% of his body and was taken toa SLC burn unit and died the next day.

properties.name: Grand Geyser
properties.description: Posted by UrbanatlagentWY, USAOn June 25, 1972 after illegally camping in the wooded hillside north of Grand Geyser, Harry Walker, 25, startled a bear that was rooting through the improperly stored food at his illegal campsite and wass attacked. He died at thee scene.

properties.name: Lat,Long: 44.46667,-110.83333
properties.description: Posted by UrbanatlagentAt Turban Geyser a woman named Fannie Weeks on August 18, 1905 fell into a hot pool here and was badly burned and subsequently died died in a hospital in Livingston 3 weeks later.

properties.name: Lewis Lake Lat,Long: 44.30542,-110.62494
properties.description: Posted by UrbanatlagentBrenton Kirk, 21 was killed by lightening strike on August 7, 1975 while boating with his brother.

properties.name: Mammoth Hot Springs, WY
properties.description: Posted by UrbanatlagentOn January 27, 1884 Emily Moore, 27, sent her son to Gardiner Mt. to obtain morphine for her painful neuralgia. She overdosed on the morphine and died.___ At the end of July in 1891, the first person to ever arrest poachers in the park, Ed Wilson, apparently committed suicide by drinking a bottle of morphine whilst sitting on top of a hill overlooking Mammoth Hot Springs, due to his unrequited love of Mary Henderson. His remains were not found until a year after his death.

properties.name: Old Faithful Cabin Camp
properties.description: Posted by UrbanatlagentOld Faithful, WYAugust 22 1942, Martha Hansen was attacked by a large bear in the middle of the night near cabin 381 in the Old Faithful Cabin Camp. She died of the injuries at Mammoth Hospital four days later.

properties.name: Rush Lake
properties.description: Posted by UrbanatlagentIn the meadow east of Rush Lake, Marvin Schrader lost his life because he went within 20 feet, of a one ton buffalo, to take it\'s photo. He died in the meadow minutes after the bison charged and gored him.He was the parks first bison fatality, on July 12, 1971.

properties.name: Stevenson Island  Lat,Long: 44.5082,-110.38191
properties.description: Posted by UrbanatlagentIn this aproximate location a human skull was found on the shore in 1907.The skull is believed to be that of either W.B. Taylor or Harry Allen, who both drowned in the lake near West Thumb in 1906.

properties.name: Turbid Lake Lat,Long: 44.54962,-110.25879
properties.description: Posted by UrbanatlagentIn 1916 on September 8th a grizzly bear attacked Frank Welch near Ten Mile Spring near Turbid Lake.He died later at Fort Yellowstone. The bear die too, after it was intentionally blown up with dynamite.

properties.name: West Thumb Lat,Long: 44.41882,-110.5652
properties.description: Posted by UrbanatlagentAugust 26, 1906 WB Taylor and Harry Allen drowned after their small rowboat capsized about 100 yards from West Thumb. Four other people that had also been on the boat survived.

properties.name: White Lake
properties.description: Posted by UrbanatlagentOn July 30, 1984 a 25 year old Swiss woman, Brigitta Fredenhagen camped alone at a backcountry campsite near White Lake and was attacked and killed by a grizzley bear while she slept. The grizzley bear was never captured and this area has been closed off for overnight camping.

properties.name: Yellowstone National Park
properties.description: Posted by Urbanatlagent Yellowstone National ParkThe worlds first National Park and one of the worlds largest active volcano calderas.
